headline: Lead IT Specialist at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)

positions.description:
â¢	Coordinate, plan and schedule IT project with in the DC metro area.  Construct cost and time estimates; assign resources to deployment projects.  Review deliverables from client submission.
â¢	Meet with OCIO SMEs and customers to determine their infrastructure needs; make recommendations for systems implementation; prepare RFP or statement of work for vendors
â¢	Perform site surveys to develop customer requirements of telecommunications and infrastructure, and develop documentation of new or existing systems and building conditions
â¢	Lead design activities including; floor plan mark up for electrical/data/wireless/voice/video, rack elevation drawings, computer room layouts, cable ladder layouts, etc.
â¢	Responsible of design activities to support voice, data, structured cabling infrastructure, low-voltage, fire/life/security, communication systems, security systems, and other low-voltage systems
â¢	Lead implementation activities including but not limited to circuit upgrades, workstation refreshes, network infrastructure upgrades, new office builds, office relocations, OCONUS upgradesâ¦
â¢	Ensure that ICE standards are met in the implementation of new facilities, modernization or repair of existing facilities, and creation of new technology workspaces
â¢	Ensure appropriate fundamental configuration and capacity in planning and design of the cable pathways
â¢	Review facilities drawings and vendor proposals and recommend modifications as necessary to bring into compliance with ICE standards and best practices
â¢	Complete quality assurance review and provide statements for follow-up work required, when systems are installed by external communications vendors
â¢	Assist fellow engineers in development

positions.title: Senior Deployment Engineer

positions.description:
â¢	Design and document large scale wireless networks (including 802.11 wireless environments) and supporting infrastructure.Perform site surveys  and create bill of materials
â¢	Conduct and document detailed wireless site surveys. 
â¢	Troubleshoot network connectivity issues and outages in a wired (802.3) and wireless (802.11) TCP/IP network.

â¢	Create and maintain configuration documentation for networks.
â¢	Lead and execute projects.
â¢	Identify when external resources are required to complete assigned tasks.
